amendment.description: To strengthen Social Security and Medicare without raiding it to pay for new Government programs, like Obamacare, that have failed Americans by increasing premiums and reducing affordable health care options, to reform Medicaid without prioritizing able-bodied adults over the disabled, and to return regulation of insurance to State governments.

action.text: Amendment SA 52 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 52 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 31 - 67. Record Vote Number: 5.
Point of order that the amendment violates section 305(b)(2) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 52.
Amendment SA 52 proposed by Senator Enzi for Senator Flake.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 52 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 31 - 67. Record Vote Number: 5.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 52 proposed by Senator Enzi for Senator Flake.
